meanings.def: the work of repairing and cleaning an old building, a painting, etc. so that its condition is as good as it originally was
examples: for restoration The palace is closed for restoration.
The government did much to facilitate these restorations.
This historic building is currently awaiting restoration.

meanings.def: the act of bringing back a system, a law, etc. that existed previously
examples: the restoration of diplomatic relations between the two countries
Protesters called for the full restoration of civil liberties.
the full restoration of Sino-US relations

meanings.def: the act of returning something to its correct place, condition or owner
examples: the restoration of the Elgin marbles to Greece

meanings.def: the time in Britain after 1660 when, following a period with no king or queen, Charles II became king
examples: Restoration comedy/poetry (= written during and after this time)
